summary: A wen charm written in a space on the verso of the final leaf. Main text of the manuscript is a Latin commentary on the Psalms of s. xmed. Ker notes that the manuscript was originally from the same scriptorium perhaps in Winchester as Royal 2 B. v, and that it was ‘later at Worcester, perhaps already in s. xii, to judge from the script of the title in red rustic capitals on fol. 1’ (1957, p. 320).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 106v) Ƿenne Ƿenne Ƿenchichenne he ne scealt þu timbrien

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 106v) sƿa litel | þu geƿurþe alsƿa linsetcorn ˥ miccli lesse alsƿa anes hand | ƿurmes hupeban ˥ alsƿa licel þu geƿurþe þæt þu naƿiht | geƿurþe

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee, with reference to published scholarship (2012).
